results.title: Spy Trap
results.brief_description: This Australian documentary/drama tells how the defection of Soviet spy Vladmir Petrov in Canberra 1954 led to a political crisis in Australia and the eventual ‘smoking out’ of the century’s master spy, Harold Russell (Kim) Philby - a senior KGB agent for more than fifty years. Included is much of the most recent footage of Philby himself.

Included is much of the most recent footage of Philby himself.

results.title: Spy kids
results.creator_credit: Robert Rodriguez, Elizabeth Avellan, Troublemaker Studios and Dimension Films
results.brief_description: Gregorio Cortez (Antonio Banderas) and Ingrid Cortez (Carla Gugino) are a happily married couple living with their two children, Carmen and Juni, in a seemingly regular existence except for the fact that Gregorio and Ingrid are both professional spies. When their parents are kidnapped, Carmen and Juni are required to put their sibling rivalry aside and band together (hoping they have inherited some of their parents’ skills) in order to save them. Using a plethora of high tech gadgets and computer-generated stunts, “Spy kids” makes for good family fun, with a well-paced narrative and amusing script. Scottish actor Alan Cumming revels in the role of Fegan Floop a mastermind of devilry who aims to bring down the Cortez couple and rule the world. The aesthetic of the film overflows with lurid colour, in particular the elaborate setting of Floop’s castle with his peculiar army of plasticine-like figures and thumb-men. The film marks a shift in genre for director Robert Rodriguez (El Mariachi, Desperado, From dusk till dawn) whose previous efforts have been films of a more violent and bloody nature. Also starring Terri Hatcher, Robert Patrick and Tony Shaloub.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Rodriguez, Elizabeth Avellan, Troublemaker Studios and Dimension Films

results.title: Spy hard
results.creator_credit: Rick Friedberg, Jeffrey Konvitz, Doug Draizin and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Special Agent Dick Steele (Leslie Nielsen) aka Agent WD-40, is brought out of retirement to save the world from destruction and annihilation by the hands of the notorious General Rancor (Andy Griffith) who has a hidden missile at a secret base. Agent WD-40 teams up with KGB Agent Veronique Ukrinsky (Nicollette Sheridan) aka Agent 3.14, to find her kidnapped scientist father who as it turns out holds the key to foiling Rancor’s evil plan in the form of a special computer chip. Cast also includes Charles Durning, Marcia Gay Harden, Barry Bostwick.

results.title: Spun out
results.brief_description: Serious illness not only can bring a family closer together but it can make them stronger and more willing to accept alternative options when the traditional way is just not working. Life can be tough but the joy is in seeing your loved ones recovering.

results.title: Spuds again

results.title: Sprout wings and fly
results.creator_credit: Les Blank, Cece Conway, Alice Gerrand and Flower Films
results.brief_description: A touching tribute to Appalachian culture in the form of a profile of the legendary mountain fiddler, Tommy Jarrell - “I eat when I’m hungry, I drink when I’m dry. If I get to feeling much better I’m going to sprout wings and fly”.

results.title: Springtime in the Rockies
results.creator_credit: Irving Cummings, William Le Baron and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Betty Grable abandons Broadway fame and takes off for the beautiful Canadian Rockies after she has a falling out with her leading man (John Payne). All manner of complications arise when Payne pursues her with a highly unlikely secretary (Carmen Miranda) in tow. In the Rockies, Grable meets up with a former dance partner (Cesar Romero) and decides to teach philandering Payne a lesson in the art of two-timing. The two women lead the men a merry dance in this colourful musical. Carmen Miranda proves to be a fine comedienne with her fractured English and Grable and Romero set the screen ablaze with some wonderful dance routines. Several hit songs are featured in this tuneful showcase.
